title: Respiratory therapist
summary: A respiratory therapist is a specialized healthcare practitioner trained in critical care and cardio-pulmonary medicine in order to work therapeutically with people suffering from acute critical conditions, cardiac and pulmonary disease.  Respiratory therapists graduate from a college or university with a degree in respiratory therapy and have passed a national board certifying examination.  The NBRC (National Board for Respiratory Care) is the not-for-profit organization responsible for credentialing the seven areas of Respiratory Therapy in the United States.
